channel.title: Upcoming FreeBSD Events
channel.description: RSS feed of upcoming FreeBSD-related conferences, summits, courses, and other relevant events.

item.title: FOSDEM 2019
item.description: FOSDEM 2019 (https://fosdem.org/2019/), Free University of Brussels, Solbosch Campus, Brussels, Belgium 02 - 03 February, 2019. The Free and Open Source Software Developers' European Meeting (FOSDEM) is a free event for software hackers to meet, share ideas and collaborate. Every year 8000+ open source developers from all over the world gather at the event in Brussels, Belgium. During the FOSDEM, developer rooms (devrooms) are assigned to self organized open source groups and projects to meet together and showcase their projects; a BSD devroom will host talks about BSD operating systems and projects. If you want to submit a talk, see the CfP.

item.title: AsiaBSDCon 2019
item.description: AsiaBSDCon 2019 (https://2019.asiabsdcon.org/), Tokyo University of Science, Tokyo, Japan 21 - 24 March, 2019. AsiaBSDCon is a conference for users and developers on BSD based systems. The conference is for anyone developing, deploying and using systems based on FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, DragonFlyBSD, Darwin and MacOS X. AsiaBSDCon is a technical conference and aims to collect the best technical papers and presentations available to ensure that the latest developments in our open source community are shared with the widest possible audience.

item.title: Hackathon 201904
item.description: Hackathon 201904 (https://wiki.freebsd.org/Hackathon/201904), University of Aberdeen, Fraser Noble Building, Room 213, Aberdeen, United Kingdom 17 - 19 April, 2019. The Aberdeen hackathon is placed at the half way point between AsiaBSDCon and BSDCan to give ardent hackers something to fill their time. Deadline for registration is March 31st, 2019.

item.title: BSDCan 2019
item.description: BSDCan 2019 (https://www.bsdcan.org/2019/), University of Ottawa, Ottawa, Canada 15 - 18 May, 2019. A four day BSD conference held in Ottawa, Canada. BSDCan hosts talks and tutorials on a range of topics based around the BSD family of operating systems.
